explain:
The original text of the news suggests a sensational story where a husband, in response to his wife's infidelity, gave her half of everything he owned by literally cutting his possessions in half. However, the external resources provided indicate that the story and the accompanying video are a hoax. Specifically, one of the external resources states that the video of the German man cutting his possessions in half was a marketing stunt and not a genuine act of post-divorce spite. This information directly contradicts the narrative suggested by the original text of the news.

The story plays on common themes of revenge and justice in the context of divorce, which could easily lead people to believe it's true due to the emotional response it may elicit. However, the fact that it has been revealed as a marketing stunt places it in the category of "Misleading Content." This is because the information was deliberately manipulated to deceive the audience into thinking it was a real event when it was not.
